keyTakeAways: A federal judge ruled that books on race and gender, removed from school libraries on military bases, must be returned due to improper partisan motives behind their removal.
Students from military bases in Virginia, Kentucky, Italy, and Japan filed a lawsuit claiming their First Amendment rights were violated when schools removed books and canceled inclusive events.

The removals were linked to executive orders from President Trump and guidance from Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth, which banned discussion of Critical Race Theory, gender ideology, and identity-based celebrations like Black History Month.
DoDEA staff directed teachers to remove books on topics such as sexual identity, racism, and LGBTQ+ pride, and cancel events such as Holocaust Remembrance Day and Black History Month.
The ACLU filed a legal motion on behalf of students, arguing that the censorship created a climate of fear in classrooms where students are now afraid to discuss race and gender.
Judge Patricia Tolliver Giles concluded the book removals were not based on educational goals but on political ideology, and ordered the immediate return of all quarantined or removed materials.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A federal judge has ordered the Department of Defense to return books on race and gender to school libraries on military bases, following a lawsuit by 12 students from Virginia, Kentucky, Italy, and Japan. The students claimed that DoDEA officials removed nearly 600 books and canceled events—such as Black History Month, Women’s History Month, and Holocaust Remembrance Day—based on policies from President Trump and Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth, which banned discussion of Critical Race Theory, gender ideology, and identity-based celebrations. The ACLU filed a motion arguing that the actions violated students’ First Amendment rights and created a climate of fear in classrooms. Judge Patricia Tolliver Giles ruled that the removals were not pedagogical but politically motivated, and ordered the immediate restoration of all removed books and curricular materials.
title: Books about race and gender to be returned to school libraries on some military bases
